intro: Blepharis gazensis, commonly known as the Ganzan hairless grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Blepharis gazensis is often found in open vegetation and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
